alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 5:29PM MST until August 24 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR PORTIONS OF THE GRAND CANYON UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 527 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated only light rain continues at this time. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen from earlier heavy rainfall and will continue to cause runoff and flooding on creeks, streams, and washes. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grand Canyon National Park, Hualapai Reservation, Supai and Havasupai Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Jumpup Canyon, Hundred and Twentyseven Mile Creek, Tapeats Creek, Colorado River, Little Coyote Canyon, Albers Wash, Deer Creek, Kanab Creek, Havasu Creek, Hundred and Twentyeight Mile Creek and Sowats Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
